result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeffrey J Sponholz was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 478 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Fine is to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision (can be taken out of prison wages).

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Village of Lannon Police Department.  Blood draw fee and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision (can be taken out of prision wages).
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Ignition Interlock Device Installed for the period of probation.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jeffrey J Sponholz in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  
Jury Trial Canceled.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed by operation of law.
Defendant presented statements to the court.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  102 Months
Initial Confinement:  42 Months
Extended Supervision:  60 Months
478 Days Credit.

36 Months  D/L REVOCATION
36 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
DNA sample to be provided.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $60 (to be forward to Village of Lannon Police Department);
FINE:  $3,801
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of th Sentence (can be taken out of prison wages).


Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
